Reviews.Title: “goood location for city visit”
Reviews.Author: RSMUL
Reviews.Content: If arriving and departing via the Termini this hotel is perfectly positioned. Also it is within walking distance for all the main sites, for active walkers. Rooms adequate and en suite facilities good. The staff very helpful and friendly. Breakfast, at best, was only average. Would consider again if visiting Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Honest staff”
Reviews.Author: Annajm
Reviews.Content: The room that we had was a double room, but it is too small. At night we heard the people walking and talking along the corridors. The bathroom was soooo small. Make sure that you do not take your shower at the same time with the other guests, or else you will end up showering in ice-cold water. The free continental breakfast was fairly OK, but the dining area was soooo small, too. The staff were very helpful, And honest!!! We forget some stuff in the room when we checked-out, and after 2 days.... they were able to return our stuff..

Reviews.Title: “Functional, value for money”
Reviews.Author: Givemelegroom
Reviews.Content: It would be churlish to be critical of such a perfectly located hotel that cost so little for a double room. Certainly one that offers FREE wifi throughout. It was however unfortunate that my occupation coincided with the first snows in Rome in 25 years. Consequently, the limitations of the heating and absence of additional bedding became apparent. Given the age of the HVAC systems it seems reasonable to question how bearable the room would be in summer; although aircon is available at an additional cost. The only issues that travellers should be aware of are the absence of guest toiletries, other than hand soap and the extremely tight nature of the bathroom. As someone who has enjoyed better nourishment than necessary I found the shower cubicle somewhat restrictive, bordering on uncomfortable. Overall, the room was clean, staff very helpful and it didn't seem especially noisy. Yes,the basin was cracked and maintenance could have been better, but for what I paid it did the job.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: MaxRamult
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, five minutes from Termini station. Our room was clean and quiet - we requested a room at the back of the hotel to avoid the room which can be quite noisy. The water pressure wasn't great and the towels were paper thin, and we would recommend avoiding the breakfast service. However, the hotel reception staff were very helpful and everything else was good value for money. We would stay again - but bring our towels next time!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and location for the money”
Reviews.Author: PrimeGlobetrotter
Reviews.Content: Very close to the subway station and from the place where the airport bus leaves you. Quite close to central Rome if you are a fan of strolling around the city. Rooms are decent, clean and comfortable and the hotel staff are friendly even though they do not necessarily look very professional. Breakfast is the biggest dissapointment of all, because of the extremely low variety but you can call it basic. Not fancy place but nothing to complain about either.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay this year”
Reviews.Author: colbe_11
Reviews.Content: We use this hotel because it is an easy walk to the station. Hotel is clean. Rooms are basic, but adequate. Front staff are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: Kerryn M
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't say that I was overly dissapointed with my stay at hotel RomAntica because you really just get what you pay for. The room was okay, it was clean with a comfortable bed. The bathroom was clean but did smell a bit. breakfast was okay but not a lot of variety. However for the price and the fact that it is in Rome it was what I expected. I have three main problems with this hotel which would stop me from staying here again. Firstly; the hotel isn't in a good area, yes it is very close to the train but this is the olny positive the resturants around the hotel were not good and the area felt unsafe at night. If I ever go back I would pay the extra and stay in the older part of Rome. Secondly; there was aircon in the room but you had to pay to use it, this is really quite poor as the rooms are so hot. Finally the worst part of this hotel were the breakfast ladies. Two women served breakfast and one of the them was extremely rude, if you got a hello out of her you were very lucky. She looked around the room with an angry look on her face and made you feel very uncomfortable. This is the main reason I would not recommend staying here, no matter how much you pay for a hotel the people working there should not be rude.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Price, Clean Room, Nice Staff, Good location!”
Reviews.Author: Laurab768
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in July with my boyfriend for 4 nights in a 10 night holiday that involved Rome, Paris and Disneyland. We flew to Ciampino Airport and took the terravision coach into Termini for €8 each return! From Termini Hotel Romantica was less than a 5 minute walk! It was about 11 o clock when we got the hotel and thankfully our room was ready as we just wanted to shower and sleep after such an early flight! Unfortunately our room didn't have air conditioning (apparently we were supposed to state when booking that we wanted this service??) but the man on reception kindly gave us an electric fan to plug in for free. I don't think we would have survived without this! We got to our room and it was fine. There was a double bed, a wardrobe and a desk with a tv. We also had a balcony which was fantastic as we could rinse out our clothes and dry them on the balcony quickly. (very convenient with the crazy roman heat!). Our bathroom was big and clean and it had a double shower. There was also a safe in the room. Breakfast was included in our booking but we only availed of it one morning. There were pastries, cold hard boiled eggs, tea and coffee and jams and juices. From our hotel we were able to walk to the colleseum and one day we walked to the Vatican city. There is a supermarket near to the hotel where you an buy cold fruit and drinks and there are numerous restaurants nearby which are cheap and offer lovely food. A great thing about Rome which I think saved us about €50 was the water fountains everywhere. We only bought a couple of bottles of water and kept refilling them at the fountains. The water was lovely, cold and refreshing! All in all we had a great stay in Hotel RomAntica! And I wouldn't hesitate in reccomending it to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, convenient to main rail station - but factor in AC cost in the summer”
Reviews.Author: Yams22
Reviews.Content: This hotel was convenient to Tremini station, the main transportation hub in Rome - but also not the best area. The area around Tremini is pretty sketchy, but this hotel's area seems fairly safe, if not the most vibrant or fun. It was pretty clean, but needed a fresh coat of paint, and there was quite a bit of mold in the dry wall in our bathroom. The street is very noisy, making it impossible to get a good night's sleep with the windows open (which you'll need to do on warmer days unless you plan to pay 10 Euros for AC). The manager was helpful. The breakfast was mediocre (no fresh fruits or veggies). Overall, our stay was okay, but if we visit Rome again we'll try to find a room somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: FuzzyBear43
Reviews.Content: Reception staff were friendly and helpful. Free wi-fi worked fine, rooms were compact, but clean and well looked after. Aircon is extra, so we ended up roasting overnight in the hot June weather. The hotel is located in a good location a few minutes from the main train and bus stations, supermarkets are just around the corner. The reception also kindly let us leave our luggage at the hotel after we checked out, we still had an afternoon to spare on our last day. Breakfast is not bad for a budget hotel, the usual cereal, ham & cheese and cake continental breakfast fare, nothing special. The breakfast staff ladies looked miserable every single morning we ate and made us feel like we were eating in a graveyard, but thankfully were helpful and attended to our needs. The coffee and orange juice is crap but its free at least. Recommended, but don't do a honeymoon here.

Reviews.Title: “An ok hotel close to Termini train station”
Reviews.Author: Marassa
Reviews.Content: The location is ok if you use trains. No minibar in the room. The declared free WiFi did not work in our room (39) but I was able to pick up some other free WiFi network when standing next to the window. The room was of reasonable size but looked upon a rather noisy street. Breakfast was ok, but don't expect the breakfast staff to understand English.

Reviews.Title: “Great position if you are using the trains”
Reviews.Author: colbe_11
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. Clean, comfortable room. Very close to the station and the start of the hop-on, hop-off bus. Breakfast is fresh and served politely.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money ang great location”
Reviews.Author: kostasicebar
Reviews.Content: it was my second time in Rome so i knew that hotels in this city are very expensive,so with 55 euros per night i was very satisfied.the location is very good,just 3 minutes from termini which was good because in the return we had a very early flight so we needed to be close to the train station.in termini also there is a metro station and many buses going around rome.breakfast was very good for the poor Italian standards.3 kind of cereals,donuts,croisants,coffee,juice,yogurt,cheese,ham,salami!the room was small but clean and in good condition,bathroom small but good.(in Rome you need the room just for sleep and shower)...

Reviews.Title: “Totally underrated”
Reviews.Author: toftedalen
Reviews.Content: Hotel RomAntica is simply a nice place to stay - at a very affordable price. Friendly staff, 24 hour desk, clean and good rooms, calm atmosphere, fine breakfast and free internet! Splendid restaurants in the same street. What else matters?

Reviews.Title: “Close to Termini, good staff and affordable for Rome”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellervm
Reviews.Content: This hotel was only 3 streets away from the main train station Termini, had several cafes down the street and cheap internet/net cafes nearby too. Air con was extra, which wasnt in our budget so we had to go without. Some nights it would have been worth the extra dollars for it though. The room was a good size. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Sometimes the street was very nosy so sleep was impossible, otherwise it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelfanaticsUk
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of its central location - 2 minutes walk from Termini rail and metro Stations and 20 minutes walk from the Colosseum. It's billed as a 2 star hotel. It's only that because it has no facilities other than a breakfast room. However it'smuch better then 2 stars in terms of the quality of the rooms. They were not huge, but were big enough. The bed was firm but comfortable, the bathroom was fine - shower, basin, toilet and bidet. The bedroom and bathroom were spotlessly clean and we got clean towels every day (although the bath towels were waffle cotton - a bit like tea-towels). One of us had a room at the front over-looking the street. It was too noisy to leave the windows open. Our room was at the back which was nice and quiet. The breakfast was an excellent continental breakfast - orange juice, tea, coffee, cereals (cornflakes, coc-pops and muesli), fresh bread rolls wirth butter and jam, croissants, danish pastries and apricot tart. There was no bar or restaurant in the hotel, but that's not a problem as there are plenty of trattorias and bars in the neighbourhood (the Aqua Nera was the best), Meals are quite reasonable - 12-22 euros for a three course 'tourist' menu, with a good choice of starter and main course. Also there's a small supermarket close by which sells wine, beer, spirits etc. The reception staff were very helpful - even lending us a bottle opener.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: ADMarshall
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel RomAntica at the end of September 2010. We arrived in Rome around 9:15 am and took the Leonardo Express train from the airport to the Termini train station. The hotel is very close to the Termini, so it was easy to find. We were able to check in early which was very nice and check in was easy and painless. We were given a room on the 3rd floor so we took the tiny elevator up to our floor. The room was fine as we were only using it to sleep and shower, but I would say it’s only about a “2 star” hotel. There was a tiny safe on the wall and our window opened to a noisy street below. There was a small TV which we didn’t really watch because we could not find any English stations. The bathroom and shower were decent, but note that this hotel did not provide any shampoo, conditioner, or lotion—just soap. The room needed some updating—it could use a fresh coat of paint on the walls and the bedspread could use a good cleaning. We removed it right away and stored it in the armoire. The bed was comfortable, but be sure to bring your earplugs because the street noise was terrible! We booked this hotel for several reasons, but one of the big reasons was because it said it had air conditioning. We weren’t sure how hot it would be in Rome in September, so that was one thing we were looking for. Yes, this hotel does offer air conditioning….for an additional 10 Euros per night. We went ahead and opted for it because it was in the 80s and it was stuffy in our room, but it was a little disappointing to have to pay extra for it. The other reason we booked this hotel was because it said they offered free Wi-Fi. This is true, but you have to get a card from the front desk. The first night I was given two cards that would last for one hour each. The second night we went back for another card, and were then given a card that would last indefinitely. There was no extra charge for these access cards. One thing we really enjoyed about this hotel was their breakfast. Our room rate included breakfast so we ate it each day. I had read negative reviews about the breakfast, but we really enjoyed it! They had cereal, milk, different breads and pastries, orange juice, and coffee or cappuccino. Everything was delicious! Overall, it was a fine place to stay. The hotel is in a good location, close to many restaurants and a nice grocery store and very close to the main train station which made travel around the city easy. We felt safe at night as the reception area is manned 24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: aileronguy
Reviews.Content: To start with the positives, the room was big and clean enough for Rome and is located really close to the train station which saves packing luggage across town. The problem here really is the customer service and overall value. Though we only paid 70 Euros, we were asked to pay for extra's that we were lead to believe were included. We asked if the room had air conditioning and reception said they did. When we tried to turn it on we couldn't figure out how. I went to the reception and they said it would be an extra 10 Euro per night. I tried to protest that I was lead to believe it was included, but to no avail. Also they informed us where breakfast was when we checked in, but failed to mention it would be an extra 10 Euro each. Given this, the low price wasn't so low. When we checked out I wanted to use my remaining Euro cash to save the exchange fee and pay the rest with credit card. I have done this numerous times when returning from abroad, but the reception said he didn't want to do that (not that he couldn't, just didn't want to). I pleaded, but again to no avail, he simply did not want to help us out. Overall a low price does not warrant this low level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in Rome”
Reviews.Author: AG2
Reviews.Content: A perfect stay in Rome, very close to the main attractions. The rooms are spacious and clean. The hotel is rather small but has been recently refurbished. Some negative points are the noise, especially during the evenings, and the breakfast staff which were rather rude.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: Baboly
Reviews.Content: Stayed 7 nights at this hotel and can't complain. When you stay in Rome you need a place to relax after a busy day of visiting the beauty of this city and that's what you need from a hotel. The breakfast was not good and when I spoke with Evan the receptionist, he said, we know about that but our margin in limited because of the commission we pay to web sites who book the rooms for us. There is a solution for this problem, you can go to a close by grocery store and buy what you like and bring it to breakfast room. This is what we did after first day's breakfast, otherwise we could not survive to have the same breakfast for 7 days we stayed.! The best value hotel in Rome with friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the main station, kind staff, good price!”
Reviews.Author: sjave
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect, only 5 min walking from the main station, and so from all the metro e buses connection: if you are tired to walk and you are on the opposite side of the town, just check a bus stop and you'll surely get a bus going to the station! The staff is definitely kind and helpful for any information you need. The breakfast, well, it's not much but for the price it's definitely enough! The rooms are cleaned and furnished with classic style. The only problem I had was a really noisy family on the other side of the wall, probably they were living there, and the view from the window was definitely poor. But for a 2 night stay it was not a problem...and anyway, that is Rome in its beauty and ugliness! :)

Reviews.Title: “Best Budget hotel near termini”
Reviews.Author: RArun
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 days in Hotel Romantica during our christmas break. The hotel is just 5 minutes walk from termin sation. The room was small but very convenient. The rooms and bathrooms were kept clean and they changed the towels every day. Breakfast was included in the price. We got a chance to have breakfast on 2nd day,it was basic(bread,coffe, crossiant,and orange jiuce(was not gud)) but overall it was good. Nice people at reception and they gave very good support. I would stay again in this hotel, Overall Value for money (One of the best budget hotels) near termini sation. NB: We booked this hotel after seeing the Trip advisor Review.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value...”
Reviews.Author: mammea
Reviews.Content: It was the second time we stayed at Hotel Romantica.It is very close to Termini station, so it has a great location, which is a big advantage.The rooms facing the street are quite noisy but the rooms not facing the street are absolutely quiet at night. Our room was very small but clean, the bathroom was also clean, we got new towels every day.There are no bugs in the rooms, they are really clean so it's a perfect hotel to get back to in the evenings after a long day in beautiful Rome. Breakfast is very basic (one roll, one croissant, butter and jam, coffee, tea, terribly bad orange juice) but enough to start your day with. The two ladies in the breakfast area don't speak any languages only Italian, though:-(( Great value for money (we paid 55 euros for 1 night).

Reviews.Title: “Small but nice...”
Reviews.Author: Sharo72
Reviews.Content: We visited Roma with wife and wanted some not too expensive hotel. Hotel RomAntica suites perfectly. It is small city hotel close to Termini but in fact as Rome is not so huge you can easily walk from hotel to city center. In some 20-30 you reach it. Rooms are rather small but for sleeping there quite enough. Avoid breakfast, we did not have, but noticed in reviews that not worth money. Above all around you can eat for fair money. In general I liked that hotel. Above one evening on walk back to hotel, we met at Piazza dela Repubblica Robert de Niro and Al Pacino. .. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Location is Great; Breakfast below average”
Reviews.Author: jhavi
Reviews.Content: The main positive of the hotel is its location. It is not more than two minutes walk from the main railway station. Rooms were large and decently clean. Breakfast was one of the disappointing factor. However, good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BJLL
Reviews.Content: Hotel was basic but clean and good value for money. We were able to walk to some attractions and the main train station was about a 2 minute walk away. We had read that this area was not very good at night but did not find this at all. The only complaint we had was the breakfast was terrible, even though it was included in the room price we prefered to go out and pay for something decent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for a Roman holiday”
Reviews.Author: Winterfresh
Reviews.Content: The Romantica Hotel is located just a few minutes walk from Rome's central station, where there are connections to the train from the airport as well as the city's subway system. The neighburhood is dominated by small shops, a few supermarkets and touristy restaurants. Walking to the Forum Romana and Colusseum takes about 15 minutes. The rooms were clean and good for value, altough there was some dust under the bed so if you have any allergies you might have some troubles. The double bed was acctually two seperate beds which kept sliding aprt during the night, which is a bit contradictory to the romance theme hinted at in the hotel name. :) I found the service offered by the reception staff (open 24/7) very good, but the breakfast staff were quite rude. Breakfast is limited to coffee with white bread and jam, so for a more substantial breakfast you are better off hitting one of the cafes in nearby piazzas. Although it is no place for honeymooners I would certainly come back because of its central location and relative good value.

Reviews.Title: “No frills hotel in convenient location for the metro”
Reviews.Author: UkCath123
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very basic, but clean and tidy. Staff were helpful and polite. The room was very cold (it was February and very chilly!). Some of the smoke alarms had been covered for smokers and the smell of smoke often drifted into our rooms. The location was very convenient for getting around Rome, but it was very noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot!”
Reviews.Author: Muffles6012
Reviews.Content: We thought this hotel was great. We stayed here for 3 nights in January. It was right beside the Termini, so it was very handy as the sightseeing buses also leave from here and if you are flying by Ryanair to Ciampino you can get the tickets on board return, this bus drops you the other side of termini. Reception was very friendly and helpful when we checked in and out.Rooms were lovely and warm the bed was comfy but be warned rooms are very basic. The only gripe i would have was that it was quite noisey early in the morning. and the breakfast wasn't the best so we skipped it and got coffee and danishes in the lovely little cafes in the area. I would probably stay here again when I return to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Deal at RomAntica”
Reviews.Author: BUcinTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at Christmas. The deal was good and though we were a little worried about the location it was a great stay. The room was clean and a good size. The bathroom was large enough to house what it needed. The location is close to the train station which is nice so you can catch the metro or bus to the sights. I was worried about what I had heard/read about being close to the termini but I never felt unsafe. The staff was always nice and helpful which made the stay even better.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: VegasNooB
Reviews.Content: Initially upon booking this hotel, we were a bit apprehensive, but when we left Rome, we were very pleased with the hotel. The room was clean, the staff was friendly, and the area was fine. We never felt unsafe - as with ALL areas of Rome, it's important to stay aware of your surroundings and keep an eye on the other people, but the Termini area felt no less safe than any other part of town we visited. The staff was extremely friendly, helping us practice our Italian, offering suggestions of places to go, quick ways to reach a tourist spot, etc. The room, while small, was clean and had the necessary amenities, including a safe. We faced the street and did not find the noise to be that disruptive - in fact, it was lovely as one evening, a strolling musician stopped at the restaurant below our window. We had free entertainment as we got ready for dinner. Our only complaint was a bit of noise from the adjoining rooms as those guests returned very late after a night of clubbing. We never took advantage of the free breakfast, but based on the comments from other guests there, it was apparently more than adequate. This is definitely not the best place for those seeking tons of amenities - it's pretty bare-bones. However, it's an excellent price for a clean room in a convenient location. We'd recommend for those on a budget who plan to only use their room for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Room contained free safe, hairdryer...”
Reviews.Author: cathhughes
Reviews.Content: Were worried as it was a cheap option for New Year. But could not fault the hotel. Room was very pleasant with a large bathroom. Facilities - hairdryer, safe (free), heating you could control (free). Lift. Reception stored our luggage on our last day. Having stayed in Rome before (at Welcome Residences), we asked for an inside room looking out onto a courtyard as it can be very noisy in Rome. No fridge or shampoo and I noticed that you had to pay 10E for air conditioning. Breakfast very good. Bread rolls and plain coisqoints available - which you do not get in most hotels in Italy. No Lounge area to sit in. No internet access, but there are plenty of places around. Very hard to find... turn down by the south side of termini station, walk down and turn left beside the "Champagne Hotel" and the hotel is just on the right. Once you know where it is, then it is very easy and very convenient place (about 2 roads down from station). Have a great break in Rome. Any advice you need about the hotel or sights in Rome, please ask. If you are booking Terravision transfer please contact us for advice. cathathowells@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything except for the noise”
Reviews.Author: Ronnie777Toronto
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of the hotel, it was a couple of steps away from the main railway and metro terminal in Rome. There's plenty of restaurants around and you could get anything you needed from the terminal station. We also loved the decor and appreciate the good size of the room. The breakfast was descent with croissant, cereal and coffee/ tea. Our biggest complaint has to be the noise, the walls are way to thin and even though our room faced the courtyard, we heard anything that happened in the hallways. Maybe we had back luck with people staying around us, but we knew exactly when people went back to their rooms and when they left. To me, a good night sleep is extremely important when it comes to hotels, this one drawback dropped my impression of this hotel from ok to just average. Other than that, we thought the service was very good and the girl at the reception in the afternoon was extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: our-honeymoon2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel was better than what we were expecting. I would rate it about 4 stars. We had a room facing the courtyard and it was recently renovated. The rooms are very clean inside and bathrooms are fantastic. Quite big for european standards so there's plenty of room. If you are travelling in summer, you will definitely need air conditioning and this is an extra cost - so be prepared for that. Breakfast is typical european, just a coffee and a crossant - you may have some cereal on offer but nothing big. Hotel is nice and close to the station but in a good area. The station area can be dangerous at night time but the hotel is just far enough away to avoid that. It has lots of restaurants near by and is a very short walk to the main attractions. I would stay here again. Price is very reasonable for what you get ( we paid 110 euro per night)

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: BukkenBruse
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms to accommodate a family of five. While one hotel room was facing towards the courtyard and was very quiet, the other room was facing the street and was incredibly noicy. The rooms were very plain and basic, the bathrooms were tiny and fortunately fairly recently renovated. The breakfast was adequate and the girls who served us were not particularly friendly, but that was a minor inconvenience. We rarely used the tiny lift but walked the stairs up to our rooms. The railings have not been cleaned in a few years judging by the thick layer of dust. Still, the rooms were reasonably clean. The location was great, only minutes away from the station and very central. We love walking and covered most of the centre by foot from this hotel, including the Colosseum, the Spanish Steps and Trastevere.

Reviews.Title: “Good base for Rome explorations”
Reviews.Author: Lotti096
Reviews.Content: This is a comfortable, clean and conveniently located hotel at a very good price (especially considering Rome prices). It is located about a 5 minute walk from the Termini train station, various bus and metro lines, and within easy walking distance of many sites (Rome is best explored on foot anyway!) Our room was not especially spacious, but it was very clean, had comfortable beds and a good shower, and the option to use air conditioning if required (although beware that there is an extra 10 EUR charge for it per night if you do opt to use it--we didn't). Staff were friendly and spoke English. Breakfast is simple and nothing special, although this was not a problem for us (those who require big breakfasts could easily pick something up from the many nearby stores and cafes). The surrounding area, unsurprisingly when considering the hotel's proximity to the train station, can be a little shady at night, although we never had any problems and never felt unsafe. One tip--don't rely on the Romantica's website map to help you find the hotel--it isn't very well labelled. Would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a friendly, comfortable and conveniently located hotel in Rome at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: banger6715
Reviews.Content: Hotel RomAntica was is in the best location, literally about 4 minutes walk to the main termini station. The room we had was very clean and comfortable and looked recently re-furbished as everything appeared brand new. The staff were very friendly and spoke good english. Air con is available at a cost of ten euros per night and well worth it in the summer heat. There is not one negative thing I can say about the Hotel and I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome and I would certainly stop here again.

Reviews.Title: “Too Noisy”
Reviews.Author: Latsydney
Reviews.Content: Review located five min walk from Termini. Had read some reviews that this area wasn't safe, but seemed ok. Hotel room was clean, decent bathroom, and decent size compared to other rooms we'd stayed in. However we had a room facing the street and it was very very noisy. Breakfast wasn't bad, AC was an extra ten euros. Probably wouldn't stay here again unless we could get a room that wasn't noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Safe, Clean”
Reviews.Author: SazMV
Reviews.Content: After much hesitation about staying close to Termini due to concerns about safety, we opted for the convenience of being able to walk to our hotel to/from the train station. While the area is not super charming it has a bustling friendliness and never felt unsafe. It took less than 5 minutes to walk from the train station. The hotel is safe and clean with smallish but comfortable rooms & bathrooms. The staff was friendly and helpful. This was our only hotel with an elevator -- what a luxury! Plenty of restaurants right nearby. A decent place to stay in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RogerRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, near at Termini Station. close at bus stop, metro and other transportation. We haven´t had a problem when we walked at night. You can take care about check out 11:00 AM !! I´ve bokked by internet and received wrong information about check out. The receptionist wanted to charge 60 euros.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: ron57nie
Reviews.Content: This was and excellent value, we paid 55 euros a night. the location was convienient to Termini, only a couple blocks away, this opened Rome to us allowing us to use public transportation to get around at a fraction of the cost. The Hotel is slightly off the main road and noise was not a problem, the room was small for American standards but big enough. The floor throughout was Italian tile and the bathrooms were newly renovated for a very clean feel. All new appliances and hardware in perfect working order. King size bed with very comfortable mattress and crisp sheets. There is a small safe in the room. TV but is was all Italian. Breakfast was included, nothing great but it got us to lunch with no problem. i wouldn't hesitate to return especially if you like being by yourself in a more typical italian neighborhood in a small hotel with a Eurpoean feel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, great location - thanks to tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: boffpa
Reviews.Content: Did our research through tripadvisor then booked through hlx dot com. Good, helpful and attentive staff. Near to as many of the attractions as you could want. Minutes walk from Termini Station -handy for bus to/from airports (ps do not pre-book coach transfer at 10 euro plus... use local bus 5 euros to Termini, pay on coach, leaving all those who had pre-booked waiting and looking jealous!) Breakfast 7:30 -9:30 usual continental and adequate. Was not the very cheapest we could find, was an excellent price and quality for Rome centre...would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: superwell
Reviews.Content: I really liked Hotel Romantica. The location is close to termini station (4 minute walk) but the area is very ruff at night and i would recommend staying in a better area of the city. The owners were great and helped us very much. The room is amazing and clean. Get the air conditioning for 10 more euro a night it's worth it for rome when it's 40+ degress. Most places are about 10-30 away from here by bus which is at termini station. We walked to the colosseum which worked out to be about 15-20 minutes Other then the area around the hotel I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was a truly fantastic hotel for the money. We stayed for six nights and the room was very clean and quiet - overlooking a small courtyard with plants. The hotel was situated very close to the station and in an excellent position for seeing all the sights. Our room was cleaned every day and fresh towels were supplied. The breakfast was basic but the coffee great. The staff were very helpful and let us leave our bags in the hotel as our flight was not until late in the evening. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at the hotel for 7 nights in June -06 and were very pleased. We highly recommend it, and would very likely stay there again. We chose the place mostly because of tripadvisor, and fully agree with most of the writers here. We'd give 3½ stars if that was possible. As most things, it had its pro's and con's and we thought we´d list the most important ones, as well as give a few hints about Rome that we´d wanted to know before we got there.. Pros: The location was perfect, only 100m or so from the central railway station, Termini, which is the central station for both the metro lines and several buses as well. The rooms were clean and in good condition, the toilets and showers worked well. Everything was neat and tidy, the cleaning worked perfectly, and as a big plus, NO SMOKING in the rooms nor the hallways. We got a big(ger?) room with no number called the "Privato", and always got a wide smile when picking up the key at the reception. I tried to ask the staff if there was something special with this room, but apparently they didn´t understand my question too well as the answer was " today? ". I decided to let it be. The staff was very friendly and things worked smoothly. Cons: The breakfast was not that good, packed croissants and breads, marmelade, juice and coffee. On the other hand, this seems to be the Italian standard. We made the mistake of ordering a breakfest elsewhere, and got the same thing..that wasn´t a 12 euro well spent. The room faced the street and got quite noisy at times. One night at 04.45 some morons (tourists, unnecessary to point out) decided it would be fun to play with a megaphone in the middle of the night / street. (Could happen at any hotel, can´t blame RomAntica for it) The staff managed the usual phrases in English, but I don´t think that a deeper conversation would have been possible. No minibar / fridge, and the AC was not turned on. (We didn´t ask for it to be turned on either, so I guess we only have ourselves to blame) Unrelated to the hotel, we´d like to give a few hints. - Take the red 110 sightseeing bus, the lines are long to get there, but there is a reason. The red buses are very frequent, 10mins in between, as most of the others have 1 hour. This is important if you hop off somewhere and intend to continue later. You dont want to realize that you've just missed a bus and have to wait for an hour for the next one. - The river boat. Take the river boat from Isola or at Ponte Sant' Angelo and go north and back. They only charge one single euro for a one way ticket (= total 2€) ! You don´t need any reservations or anything. This is the same boat that is included in the "Bus'n boat" tours offered by one of the bus companies. - Babbo's ristorante pizzeria (Via Cernaia 16/18, close to Porta Pia). The best one we could find! - The beach. Take the metro to Piramide (1€), and switch to a train to Lido di Ostia (1€), go to the end station and you are at the beach (entry 3€). The trip takes about 45mins. - The Vatican and the Sistine Chapel. If you intend to visit the Vatican museum and the Sistine Chapel, make sure you are there in good time before they open. We were there just before noon, and the lines were 1-1,5kms long ! ps. The metro tickets are valid for 75mins but only one ride. We decided not to understand, and used the ticket for quick back and forth rides when needed

Reviews.Title: “Good price, basic room (all you need for Rome!)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi there! So you're thinking of going to Rome; I hope you have a great time! I stayed at Hotel Romantica with my parents (triple room) from May 1 - 5, 2006. (540€ for 4 nights) The hotel is basic, but well located. You get what you pay for. We were out exploring Rome all day, so it was perfect for our purpose. It is very close to Termini, so if you get the bus/train from airport you don't have to walk far to the hotel. The staff do their job; they don't go too far out of their way to help you though, so if you're low maintenance you'll be fine. The map they give you will be your Bible for exploring Rome. There is a cheap supermarket nearby (at Santa Maria Maggiore, under the 'Upim' clothes store). The hotel is very well located for exploring Rome. 20 min walk to Colosseum; and many of the main attractions. (NB: I walked everywhere in Rome, and think I lost about 3 kgs in the process!!) There are loads of restaurants near the hotel; but don't order off the tourist menu - it's such a con! Usually food which has been pre-cooked hours beforehand and they just reheat it...it's awful. Don't fall for it like I did. Order off the real menu, and you will really enjoy the food!. PS: pizzas are so cheap and really nice, from 4€ each!. Also great gelateria at Santa Maria Maggiore with good flavours. I recommend this hotel for anyone who is in Rome to explore. It is basic for those who only want somewhere to sleep. If you're not high maintenance you will be fine! PS, breakfast is nothing to write home about, it's all in little packets. Not worth the 8 € , however if it's included in the price, then you should take it. Highly recommend: a visit to Travastere, it is absolutely gorgeous, what you picture authentic residential Rome to look like. It really made us feel as though we had experienced Rome (as opposed to just seeing the tourist sights). Also for mega authentic gelato experience, go to Bar San Calisto (Piazza San Calisto); looks dodgy from the outside, doesn't even look like it does gelato. But they are hidden in metal containers, and amazingly cheap. Best gelato I tasted in Rome, better than the famous Gelataria della Palma (Via della Madelina) & Giolotti (Via Degli Uffici del Vicario) - from Roman Holiday around Pantheon. Yes, I had gelato every single day!! If you go on a hop on hop off bus, go on the '110 Rome' bus; it is very frequent (every 10 mins) so even though the lines might be long, it is well worth it, as opposed to waiting for the ones which come by once per hour. Do not underestimate time in Rome!! Have fun, Sarah xx

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was ok but not great.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel were adequate but nothing to rave about. Our room was clean, but faced the street and it was extremely noisy. The curtains were broken so they didn't close and it was a little bright in the morning. The breakfast was not fresh, but all in packages and from a cereal dispenser...not very appetizing. I would stay for a short visit as it is very central, but nothing more than say, two nights. I do have to say that the front desk person was extremely polite and helpful throughout our stay. We were able to check in early and leave our bags for a while after check out on the last day.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The neighbourhoud is good. I expected much worse.Of course it is not the most beautiful place in rome. It is very close to termini... So it is very easy to travel to vatican, piazza espagna....Furthermore, It is close to a beautyful church and shopping street. And It is a fifteen minute walk to the colloseum, twenty to piazza venezia! The hotel is clean, it looked the same as on the internet! The beds are very comfortable, the shower is wonderful. The staff is extremely kind. We could check in at 11 in the morning. A room was directly ready. So, after our flight we could take a shower and change clothes. Check out was a little early, 10:30. But it is rome, you don't wanna get up late! We left a luggage behind in the hotel. At night, it was not scary outside. You could walk home easily or take a cab. Even at 2 o clock night, it was possible to come home. A nice man did the door open for you. Only, the breakfast is horrible! And you have to eat between 7:30 and 9:30. I would recommend this hotel to everyone! It is very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Clara79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very well located, close to trains and buses. The hotel room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Breakfast was juice, coffee/tea, croissants and bread rolls. Adequate to start the day. Rome is a gorgeous city- definitely the best time of year to go with weather and number of tourists!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, felt better than 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Moochy
Reviews.Content: Rome, February 2006 We had a 3 day trip to Rome given to us as a Xmas present from our 2 children. My daughter cautiously said "don't expect too much" with regard to the hotel, so I didn't. But when we arrived we were pleasantly surprised, the room and the bathroom were modern and clean, and looked recently re-furbished, the continental breakfast was served in a tiny dining room, but again v.clean. No bar, no English channels on TV, but we were out sight-seeing every day so that didn't matter. Would definately book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot!”
Reviews.Author: nuwart
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from Jan 22nd - 25th 2006 with my mum to celebrate her birthday. It was everything we needed, cheap (180 euros for 3nights), very clean (a must for my mum), close to the station (2mins walk), close to the sights (Forum 10 mins, Historic Centre 15 mins walk) and the area was fine. Actually Rome felt the safest major city I have visited. Thanyou to those reviews from Tripadvisor which helped me pick my stay and it was great. P.S Do not use the Terravision link bus from the airport, we paid for a return (14 euros each), it syas the bus leaves from the station 2.5 hrs before the flight we got there 2hr 45 mins before and it had gone, no apologies, no refund. Other buses run from the same place for cheaper. They referred to "circa" on the ticket which means "about" 2.5 hrs, funny it was in Italian when everything else was in English lol!

Reviews.Title: “party of seven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very clean and we had a breakfast every morning. We had two rooms to split between 7 people (4 adults, 3 small kids). Stayed on the third floor, it is close to everything. Especially if you get on the red double decker buses with the number 110 on them, cost a few more euro but takes to to every main tourist attraction. Great place for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Jim-Hazel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is close to the Termini, the outside of the building didn't look particularly appealing however the inside is different again. The reception desk is on the ground floor behind the lift next to the small but functional breakfast room. Our room was on the third floor facing the street, the street noise can be bad however the double glazing cut it right down, we didn't have the optional air conditioning (extra 10 euro's per night) as the weather was cold however it is probably essential in hot weather. The room including the shower was spotless and of a good size. The breakfasts were an extra 5 euros each and were well worth it. The staff were friendly and helpfull, we have no reservations in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good comfortable hotel, problems with booking/receptionist”
Reviews.Author: lindsalba
Reviews.Content: This was a nice clean spacious hotel, near to the station and not far from the sights. Comfortable beds, double glazing, nice bathroom. When we arrived the guy on reception was very unhelpful at first, wanted to give us a double bed when we specifically booked a twin room, and had checked by phone before arrival. However I didn't take no for an answer and after a long argument he converted the beds, but with very bad grace. Room very good for the price, breakfast a bit pricey (luke warm coffee!).

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in RomAntica for four nights. It was a very goog choice. The room was clean, quiet and nice. I can realy recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “appropriate”
Reviews.Author: sean
Reviews.Content: Stayed from October 30th-November 5th. Not far from station and about 100 metres from Saint Mary Major Basicilia. Reception on 1st floor. Very small lift. Our room(44) on 4th floor was reasonable. In fact probably more so when you consider the normal rooms around reasonablly priced hotel in this district. Breakfast in a small room on ground floor. Safe was free and in the wall. Reception was efficient and good. Enjoyed our stay and found that this hotel was appropriate and good. There was a restaurant next door that was always filled at night-although we did not eat there. We had very little distance to get our bus to the airport and to use the metro and open decked bus around Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very good location (two blocks from Termini Station), very clean and nice rooms with a very descent size (except from the shower). There are a lot of restaurants and cafes around and you are walking distance from many atractions. The only negative aspect of our experience was that we where on the first floor where the reception is and at nights it gets very noisy with the guests coming in. So I will deffinitely advice to get a room on the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location”
Reviews.Author: worldwidekev
Reviews.Content: The location is brilliant (2 mins from termini). Rooms were spotless but basic, great if you just want somewhere to sleep. Breakfast is bit on the thin side. Plenty of restaurants and bars nearby and you can walk to most attraction within half an hour. Expect to pay extra for air-con but i think this is standard. Would stay here again if ever return to rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we needed- clean, private bathroom, comfortable bed- for a good price. Would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “close to Termini Station”
Reviews.Author: Joan248
Reviews.Content: Clean room, good breakfast, shower small but lots of hot water. Would go there again

Reviews.Title: “What a gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for three nights in early December. After a very long day of travelling, this was a pleasantly well sitiuated quaint hotel that lives up to its name. The, what looked like, newly renovated rooms were beautifully decorated, and the bathrooms were spotless. The staff were extremely accommodating and the 60 euro rate included breakfast. Only a five minute walk to the train station, and fifteen to twenty minutes to the coleseum, the hotel was in a good location to see all of Rome's attractions. We would recommend this hotel to the budget traveller who wants a very clean, well situated hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the RomAntica Hotel. We booked the hotel after reading the positive revieuws. I didn't expect to much since the rate was 65 euro ( rather cheap for Rome). Buth, it was a pleasant surprise: very clean and spacious room; small bathroom buth, the most important, also very clean. We stayed at the fourth floor and at night we heard no noice coming from the street. The breakfast was sufficient, with cereals and sandwiches. The ONLY negative thing was the terrible smell in the bathroom, coming from a hole where once the toilet must have been...This is the only reasan why I would not stay there again

Reviews.Title: “What a Find”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Romantica Hotel is a small 2 star hotel, situated within a 2 minute walk of the 'Termini', the central point for The Railway, The Metro and the Buses. The rooms are small and basic but spotlessly clean. There is a TV but there were no 'English' channels. The bathroom was again small but once again was clean. The bathroom was fitted with a hairdryer. The location of the hotel made it quite noisy and to combat this you required to shut the double glazing. However, depending on the temperature, you really need to use the Airconditioning. This is an extra to your room rate and they charge 10 Euros per night. Since the room rate is excellent value for Rome this was acceptable. Breakfast consisted of Cereal, Fruit juice, Croissants, Rolls and Tea/Coffee. The staff were helpful and on our last day stowed our luggage as we has a late night flight home. If you're looking for good accommodation at Budget Prices then try the Romantica.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Very clean and centrally located. Great breakfast to start the day for all that walking around Rome. Staff very friendly and helpful, again my choice next time I'm visiting Rome.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel RomAntica
HotelInfo.Address: Via Principe Amedeo 77/C, 00185 Rome, Italy
